* Merge v1 into master by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/145
* move mocks to json files by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/147

* Stocks financials by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/150

* add certifi for wss by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/156

* vX Usage Note by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/160
* User agent version by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/161
* Raise AuthenticationError  by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/162
* make websockets have 2 apis by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/163
* fix get_ticker_details by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/166
* move examples to example dir by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/167
* cryptotrade: rename sym to pair by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/168
* address most of caleb feedback by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/169

* bump minimum python version to 3.8 by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/175
* Audited models for missing fields, removed unneeded arrays and enum imports, add Exceptions docs by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/176
* test on windows/osx by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/174
* Custom class decorator to handle excess parameters by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/177
* add contributing docs by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/182
* add limit param to financials by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/181
* Options contracts by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/183
* Add Logger by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/184
* add dependabot by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/185
* fix dependabot by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/186
* Bump mypy from 0.942 to 0.950 by @dependabot in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/187
* add codeowners by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/188
* add rest and ws specs by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/189
* lowercase vx by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/191
* add module __version__ by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/190
* Versioning guide by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/192
* Fix typos by @clickingbuttons in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/193
* add codeql workflow by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/194
* remove newline by @morningvera in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/195
* String Replacement Issue Fix by @Darcy-Linde in https://github.com/polygon-io/client-python/pull/197

name: Add next_url param to Tickers v3 for pagination
body:
You can now pass a `next_url` attribute as a parameter when using the Tickers v3 endpoint, like so:

```py
resp = client.reference_tickers_v3(next_url = 'https://api.polygon.io/v3/reference/tickers?cursor=[...]')
```

name: Fixed stocks daily open close bug
body: See #69. This release fixes a bug where users were unable to get the daily open/close from our stocks API.

name: Added missing endpoints
body:
This release adds several new endpoints to our python client:
* Reference Tickers v3
* Reference Ticker Details vX
* Reference Ticker News v2
As well as some old endpoints that this client was missing: 
* Aggregates, Grouped Daily & Previous Close (both for FX and Crypto)
* Forex Market Snapshot (single ticker)

name: Add documentation and allow users to pass http timeouts to rest client
Flexible requirements and context manager
body:
#36 Makes the package requirements more flexible
#37 Makes the RESTClient a context manager where on `__exit__` it closes the underlying http resources

name: Update Package description
body: No change to package functionality, just updating description

name: Add deps to packaging logic
body: Solves #13

name: Add ability for users to define on_error and on_close
Long description added
body: No code changes
